entry.title: Keyboard focus is not clearly visible on 'added watch expression' and 'delete watch expression' buttons in 'Source' tab.
entry.content:
Repro Steps: Launch Chrome and open any web page. Open developer tools(Hit F12 or More options-> More Tools-> Developer Tools)​. Select 'Sources' tab item and invoke it. Navigate to 'Watch' tree item and expand it. Navigate to 'Add watch' button and invoke it. Navigate to the added watch expressions and delete watch expression buttons. Observe the behavior here.
Actual Result: Keyboard focus is not clearly visible on 'added watch expression' and 'delete watch expression' buttons in 'Source' tab. On hitting Tab from 'refresh watch expressions' button, focus is moving to the 'added watch edit field', but it is not clearly visible.
Expected Result: Keyboard focus should be clearly visible for added watch expressions edit field and delete watch expression button. Visually also 'delete watch expression' button should be present while user navigate using Tab key.

entry.title: My bookmarks were deleted after your update. Please recover. Or rollback your update.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Logged out, log back in 2. Switched profiles 3.
# Problem Description My bookmarks were deleted after your update. Please recover. Or rollback your update.
# Summary My bookmarks were deleted after your update. Please recover. Or rollback your update.
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Improve visitation of JavaScript objects
entry.content: Visitation of JS objects dominates marking and also Scavenge. There's various ways using static roots to improve visitation of objects.

entry.title: CachedFlagUtils SharedPreference writes could be batched
entry.content:
The `cacheNativeFlags()` and `cacheFieldTrialParameters()` methods in `CachedFlagUtils` result in 75 and 50 calls to `SharedPreferences#apply()`, respectively, during startup in `onStartWithNative()`.
These SharedPreference updates can be batched to avoid making the expensive call to `SharedPreferencesImpl$EditorImpl.commitToMemory()`, which copies the in-memory map of SharedPreferences, more often than we need to.
Attached is a screenshot of a trace taken during ChromePublic startup.

entry.title: Regression: "Delete browsing data" is not translated into Language DE
entry.content:
Canary 126.0.6423.0 macOS 14.4.1
1.) Use Chrome Canary in Language DE 2.) Open Apple Menu Bar > Chrome or go to chrome://settings/privacy
Actual: "Delete browsing data" is not translated into Language DE
Expected: It should be translated.
This is a regression from build 126.0.6422.0 to 126.0.6423.0.

entry.title: Tests are failing: immersive_mode_tester.cc(58): Value of: reveal_ended_\n Actual: true\nExpected: false
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): immersive_mode_tester.cc(58): Value of: reveal_ended_\n Actual: true\nExpected: false
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:lacros_chrome_browsertests/ImmersiveModeBrowserViewTest.TestCaptionButtonsReceiveEventsInAppImmersiveMode/All.0 - ninja://chrome/test:lacros_chrome_browsertests/ImmersiveModeBrowserViewTest.TestCaptionButtonsReceiveEventsInAppImmersiveMode/All.1 - ninja://chrome/test:lacros_chrome_browsertests/ImmersiveModeControllerChromeosWebAppBrowserTest.Layout
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/e78c04b1f16f72ec4a12a56363a862a5
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Milo tab highlighting is off by one when switching tabs
entry.content:
Sometimes the tab highlighting is correct, eg: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9AwLeGazKb2pow6
But sometimes the blue underline is off by one, eg: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8jeKnRYNzhsXoKC
Seems it happens when switching from "overview", eg: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjY5NDM5MDU1NzgzNTI2NHxjZTIxOTFjOS1lOA

entry.title: [Merge Request] Merge CL to fill virtual card's expiration date
entry.content: Requesting to merge crrev.com/c/5459885 Tested in iOS Chrome Canary 126.0.6424.1

entry.title: Continue button does not work
entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem? fill out the form and push the Continue button.
What is the expected result? continue to next page to log in to my account.
What happens instead? Nothing happens.
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: [WPT] New failures introduced in external/wpt/html/semantics/forms/the-select-element by import https://crrev.com/c/5462280
entry.content:
WPT import https://crrev.com/c/5462280 introduced new failures in external/wpt/html/semantics/forms/the-select-element:
List of new failures: crbug.com/335324883 [ Mac12 ] external/wpt/html/semantics/forms/the-select-element/stylable-select/select-keyboard-behavior.tentative.html [ Timeout ]: https://crrev.com/c/5462280/4/third_party/blink/web_tests/TestExpectations#2656
See https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5462280/1?checksPatchset=1&tab=checks for details.
Expectations or baseline files [0] have been automatically added for the failing results to keep the bots green. Please investigate the new failures and triage as appropriate.
Upstream changes imported: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/compare/c49d2fe28c3fa8c560b07c0f05b9ba43207fa65f...c78b3e0c2b8a4a564cd00bb0e4088543303274ad Bump wptserve to version 4.0.2: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/commit/c78b3e0c2b8a4a564cd00bb0e4088543303274ad [wdspec] Improve tests for "Element Clear" and "Is Element Enabled" for disabled elements.: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/commit/43fa1aec1533f12dd707b50caf0d94c014af1af0
[0]: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/testing/web_test_expectations.md
This bug was filed automatically due to a new WPT test failure for which you are marked an OWNER. If you do not want to receive these reports, please add "wpt { notify: NO }" to the relevant DIR_METADATA file.

entry.title: [WPT] New failures introduced in external/wpt/webdriver/tests by import https://crrev.com/c/5462280
entry.content:

This bug was filed automatically due to a new WPT test failure for which you are marked an OWNER. If you do not want to receive these reports, please add "wpt { notify: NO }" to the relevant DIR_METADATA file.

entry.title: Implement ML scoring signals for Search suggestions
entry.content:
Based on a chat with manukh@, we've identified the following potential next steps with regards to implementing ML scoring signals for Search suggestions in the Omnibox:
""" 1) the server's search score is probably the most important signal. Because the server knows more about the suggestion than chromium does.
2) The other info in the search response (is entity & search subtype) might also be useful. Maybe entities are more/less useful than non-entities; and the model could adjust the server scores. Though this is less useful than the server scores because i imagine the server scores already account for this info. So it'd only be useful if we think the small local model can better consider this than the veteran server model
3) Local match info. E.g. how many times the user's done the search previously. Shortcut provider already suggests searches, so we'll get shortcut signals when they're deduped. But HQP doesn't seem suggest searches. We rely on the search provider to provide search-history suggestions. Maybe we can either rely on the HQP annotator to add the typed count, visit count, etc signals.
4) Local input info. This might be useful for the other match types as well. If a human was asked to rank omnbiox suggestions, they'd probably consider things like "if the input looks like a question, then the user probably wants to do a search, so rank searches higher". We don't haven't created a "does the input look like a question" algorithm, but maybe the model can figure it out based on signals like input length, whitespace count, etc. """

entry.title: Set up Dawn Win/ARM64 compilation
entry.content:
b/321127115 and b/332562046 track the allocation of GCE resources for Dawn Win/ARM64 builders. This bug is to track getting the actual builders online:
* CI DEPS compiler * CI ToT compiler * DEPS trybot * ToT trybot
Note that we are not ready to enable tests yet, so we will only be compiling.

entry.title: Embedded test server potentially has issues with 2MB buffers
entry.content:
I'm writing a "large URL" test with the EmbeddedTestServer. Each test makes a request for a URL with a body of length 2,097,723, and then one for a URL with a response body of length 2,097,722. Both cases use a BasicHttpResponse over HTTP/1.1. On OSX, in 2-3 test runs out of 30, fetching the first URL returns an ERR_CONTENT_LENGTH_MISMATCH, after reading 2,080,768 bytes (always that number, apparently) of the 2,097,723 bytes. I have yet to see a failure fetching the second URL.
My guess is the "2,080,768" comes from one read to our header buffer (which is 16k), and 63 full reads of our 32k body buffer, so the next read (which should also be our last read) should cross the 2MB barrier and hit the end of the request.
I suspect what's happening is OSX has a 2MB write buffer, we hit it when writing the response, the next write is async, and the async path falls over somehow, but not seeing how that can happen.
That having been said, it could be a production bug, or something else could be going down entirely.
Can't repro locally on Windows. I don't plan to dig further into this, for now.
The CL where I ran into this issue: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5443530/20 (Patch set 20, content/browser/interest_group/interest_group_browsertest.cc. I've landed the CL without those tests, so just patching that one file and running the bots on top of tree should repro)

entry.title: Measure time between Delegated Ink point paint and metadata paint
entry.content: Fire a histogram when we receive a DelegatedInkMetadata that measures the distance in time between the point being drawn as a delegated ink point, and it being drawn as a regular stroke (the metadata's timestamp).

entry.title: Umbrella tracker for Perf service deployments April 17, 2024
Service display names should be localized
entry.content:
Contrary to bug 40167241, IMO the display name should localized, as it is displayed in the Chromium Task Manager. As an example, launch the browser with `LANG=de_DE.UTF-8` on Linux, and then open Task Manager using `Shift + Esc`. Here:
- Spare renderer entry is tranlated to "Verfügbarer Renderer" - Extension entries are written as "Erweiterung: Foo"
OTOH, the utility process names are currently inconsistent. They are either: - Half translated: "Dienstprogramm: Network Service" due to the `.WithDisplayName(u"Network Service")` call. - Fully translated: "Dienstprogramm: GermanBarTranslation" due to the `.WithDisplayName(IDS_BAR)` call.

entry.title: HP Chromebook x360 14c-cc does not wake up from sleep
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Login 2. Leave computer un-touch for a few minutes, it will turn off the screen and go to sleep mode 3. Let it sleep for 1 minute, then touching the keyboard and mouse won't wake the computer
# Problem Description HP Chromebook x360 14c-cc does not wake up if sleep for more than 30 second. If it goes to sleep, touch the keyboard and mouse within 30 seconds, it will wake up If it goes to sleep, DON'T touch the keyboard and mouse, close and open the lid, it will wake up If it goes to sleep more than 30 seconds, touch the keyboard and mouse won't wake the laptop. I have to force power cycle to restart the computer.
# Summary HP Chromebook x360 14c-cc does not wake up from sleep
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug-Regression - Used to work, now broken
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: apps, once launched or when opening a section that triggers a loader, stay on the loading screen
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open app (e.g. Wizzair, Asos) 2. The app stays on loading screen 3.
# Problem Description Some apps stay on loading screen indefinitely. I've tried deleting cache, data, uninstall, reinstall, update webview to latest version, turning phone on and off but still having the issue.
# Summary apps, once launched or when opening a section that triggers a loader, stay on the loading screen
# Custom Questions #### Example URL: Apps like asos, wizzair, the "checkin" area of Ryanair app
#### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: "Show in folder" from Downloads open the path only upto "#" character
entry.content:
"Show in folder" from Downloads open the path only upto "#" character
steps to reproduce: 1. download a file "test.zip" into "downloads/#test" folder 2. Click on "show in folder" option in chrome downloads section 3. The folder "downloads" opens up in file manager
The issue is likely caused in the path parser.

entry.title: "Send Money" search bar on PayPal acting as if it's a sign in box
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Go to https://www.paypal.com/myaccount/transfer/homepage 2. Click send money box 3. Prompt to auto-fill appears
# Problem Description I raised a similar issue to this with kick.com and twitch.tv not too long ago which was resolved. The "Send Money" box on PayPal is acting as if it's a sign in box and autofill is being prompted - https://prnt.sc/U3gWPmHW-3Fp
Please see Issue 326645180 for details on what I mean if it doesn't make sense
# Additional Comments See Issue 326645180 for similar problem with other sites that was fixed
# Summary "Send Money" search bar on PayPal acting as if it's a sign in box
# Custom Questions #### Example URL: https://www.paypal.com/myaccount/transfer/homepage
#### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? No - Just that one URL
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Update Energy Saver Strings
entry.content: UXW requests to update the word "my" to "your" in the Energy Saver options

entry.title: Add test coverage for printing PDFs with various scaling options
entry.content: See bug 335373502 for the original problem. One cause for that issue happening is because there was no automated testing to test the workflow where one prints PDFs with the "fit to printable area" scale option. Add tests for this use case.

entry.title: :scope before/after pseudo-element styles are applying to :scope itself
entry.content:
https://codepen.io/miriamsuzanne/pen/bGJvyaj?editors=1100
Inside an `@scope` rule, styles applied to `:scope::before` and `:scope::after` are being applied to the `:scope` element rather than the before/after pseudo-elements. I haven't tested with other pseudo-elements that might have the same issue.

entry.title: [Android System Health Rotation Memory]: 4 regressions in system_health.memory_mobile
entry.content:
All graphs for this regression group at 1288348:1288362:
Internal (Googlers-only) Reports: - Chromium: https://chrome-perf.corp.goog/_/alertgroup?group_id=40629255-00b3-43a3-bf8b-e87a9372abae
(Legacy) Chromeperf Report: https://chromeperf.appspot.com/group_report?group_id=40629255-00b3-43a3-bf8b-e87a9372abae
Top 4 regressions (out of 4, with 0 improvements) in this group: - ChromiumPerf/android-pixel2_webview-perf/system_health.memory_mobile/memory:chrome:all_processes:reported_by_chrome:malloc:max_allocated_size_avg/load_social 38.02%: 30361629.0 -> 41903882.5 sizeInBytes - ChromiumPerf/android-pixel2_webview-perf/system_health.memory_mobile/memory:chrome:all_processes:reported_by_chrome:malloc:max_committed_size_avg/load_social 29.36%: 39117710.0 -> 50601984.0 sizeInBytes - ChromiumPerf/android-pixel2_webview-perf/system_health.memory_mobile/memory:chrome:all_processes:reported_by_chrome:malloc:max_allocated_size_avg/load_games 14.32%: 21369782.5 -> 24429101.5 sizeInBytes - ChromiumPerf/android-pixel2_webview-perf/system_health.memory_mobile/memory:chrome:all_processes:reported_by_chrome:malloc:max_committed_size_avg/load_games 13.21%: 29767907.5 -> 33701205.5 sizeInBytes
